data.quote: A picture lives by companionship. It dies by the same token. It is therefore risky to send it out into the world. How often it must be impaired by the eyes of the unfeeling.
data.author: Mark Rothko

data.quote: Abstract art is uniquely modern. It is a fundamentally romantic response to modern life - rebellious  individualistic  unconventional  sensitive  irritable.
data.author: Robert Motherwell

data.quote: Culture is something you cannot buy  something you cannot import  something you cannot learn or produce at will. A writer  an artist or musician cannot sit down and say 'Now I will produce culture.' Culture is something that evolves out of the simple  enduring elements of everyday life  elements most truthfully expressed in the folk arts and crafts of a nation.
data.author: Thor Hansen

data.quote: Dance is the only art of which we ourselves are the stuff of which it is made.
data.author: Ted Shawn

data.quote: Art is not an end in itself  but a means of addressing humanity.
data.author: Modest Mussorgsky

data.quote: All art is a revolt against man's fate.
data.author: Andri Malraux

data.quote: Art is a delayed echo.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Art is a kind of illness.
data.author: Giacomo Puccini

data.quote: One must work  nothing but work  and one must have patience.
data.author: Auguste Rodin

data.quote: Art does not reproduce the visible  rather it makes it visible.
data.author: Paul Klee

data.quote: The more horrifying this world becomes  the more art becomes abstract.
data.author: Paul Klee

data.quote: One of the recognizable features of the authentic masterpiece is its capacity to renew itself  to endure the loss of some kinds of immediate relevance while still answering the most important questions men can ask  including new ones they are just learning how to frame.
data.author: Arnold Stein

data.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Art is man's nature  nature is God's art.
data.author: P. J. Bailey

data.quote: With the pride of the artist  you must blow against the walls of every power that exists  the small trumpet of your defiance.
data.author: Norman Mailer

data.quote: All art is a kind of confession  more or less oblique. All artists  if they are to survive  are forced  at last  to tell the whole story  to vomit the anguish up.
data.author: James Baldwin

data.quote: History repeats itself  but the special call of an art which has passed away is never reproduced. It is utterly gone out of the world as the song of a destroyed wild bird.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: If you ask me what I came to do in this world  I  an artist  I will answer you: T am here to live out loud.'
data.author: Emile Zola

data.quote: Illustrations have as much to say as the text. The trick is to say the same thing  but in a different way. It's no good being an illustrator who is saying a lot that is on his or her mind  if it has nothing to do with the text. . . the artist must override the story  but he must also override his own ego for the sake of the story.
data.author: Maurice Sendak

data.quote: In any evolutionary process  even in the arts  the search for novelty becomes corrupting.
data.author: Kenneth Boulding

data.quote: The cheap  no matter how charming  how immediate  does not wear so well. It has a way of telling its whole story the first time through.
data.author: William Littler

data.quote: A work of art is a corner of creation seen through a temperament.
data.author: Entile Zola

data.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: Art gropes  it stalks like a hunter lost in the woods  listening to itself and to everything around it  unsure of itself  waiting to pounce.
data.author: John W. Gardner

data.quote: Man in Canadian art is rarely in command of his environment or ever at home in it.
data.author: Elizabeth Kilbourn

data.quote: What's an artist  but the dregs of his work - the human shambles that follows it around?
data.author: William Gaddis

data.quote: Art has no other object than to set aside the symbols of practical utility  the generalities that are conventionally and socially accepted  everything in fact which masks reality from us  in order to set us face to face with reality itself.
data.author: Henri Bergson

data.quote: Every artist preserves deep within him a single source from which  throughout his lifetime  he draws what he is and what he says and when the source dries up the work withers and crumbles.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: As an artist grows older  he has to fight disillusionment and learn to establish the same relation to nature as an adult as he had when a child.
data.author: Charles Burchfield

data.quote: Perpetual modernness is the measure of merit in every work of art.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Nothing can come out of an artist that is not in the man.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: It is not in life but in art that self-fulfillment is to be found.
data.author: George Woodcock

data.quote: An artist never really finishes his work  he merely abandons it.
data.author: Paul Valery

data.quote: I am convinced it is a mistake to find an artist human outside his work. If you cannot find him human in and through his work  you are better not to know it when you come to formulate an opinion of his public value.
data.author: Kenneth Winters

data.quote: One must work  nothing but work  and one must have patience.
data.author: Auguste Rodin

data.quote: Art does not reproduce the visible  rather it makes it visible.
data.author: Paul Klee

data.quote: In any evolutionary process  even in the arts  the search for novelty becomes corrupting.
data.author: Kenneth Boulding

data.quote: The cheap  no matter how charming  how immediate  does not wear so well. It has a way of telling its whole story the first time through.
data.author: William Littler

data.quote: Art at its most significant is a Distant Early Warning System that can always be relied on to tell the old culture what is beginning to happen to it.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: It is well with me only when I have a chisel in my hand.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: Art is based on order. The world is full of 'sloppy Bohemians' and their work betrays them.
data.author: Eduard Weston

data.quote: Living is a form of not being sure  not knowing what next or how. The moment you know how  you begin to die a little. The artist never entirely knows. We guess. We may be wrong  but we take leap after leap in the dark.
data.author: Agnes de Mille

data.quote: The artist  like the idiot  or clown  sits on the edge of the world  and a push may send him over it.
data.author: Osbert Sitwell

data.quote: Art-speech is the only truth. An artist is usually a damned liar but his art  if it be art  will tell you the truth of his day. And that is all that matters. Away with eternal truth. The truth lives from day to day  and the marvelous Plato of yesterday is chiefly bosh today.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: Art isn't something you marry  it's something you rape.
data.author: Edgar Degas

data.quote: It's not what you see that is art  art is the gap.
data.author: Marcel Duchamp

data.quote: I always suspect an artist who is successful before he is dead.
data.author: John Murray Gibbon

data.quote: An artist has to take life as he finds it. Life by itself is formless wherever it is. Art must give it form.
data.author: Hugh MacLennan

data.quote: Art upsets  science reassures.
data.author: Georges Braque

data.quote: An artist has been defined as a neurotic who continually cures himself with his art.
data.author: Lee Simonson

data.quote: Art is either plagiarism or revolution.
data.author: Paul Gauguin

data.quote: The father of every good work is discontent  and its mother is diligence.
data.author: Lajos Kassak

data.quote: A work should contain its total meaning within itself and should impress it on the spectator before he even knows the subject.
data.author: Henri Matisse

data.quote: The terror of art lies in the representation of the hidden reality with its shattering effect.
data.author: Martin Greenburg

data.quote: Drawing is speaking to the eye  talking is painting to the ear.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: We should comport ourselves with the masterpieces of art as with exalted personages - stand quietly before them and wait till they speak to us.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Be regular and orderly in your life like a bourgeois  so that you may be violent and original in your work.
data.author: Gustave Flaubert

data.quote: The painting rises from the brushstrokes as a poem rises from the words. The meaning comes later.
data.author: Joan Miro

data.quote: Caricature is rough truth.
data.author: George Meredith

data.quote: A work of art is an exaggeration.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: Art not only imitates nature  but also completes its deficiencies.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: When one admires an artist it is important not to know him personally.
data.author: Jacinto Benaventey Martinez

data.quote: Art for art's sake.
data.author: Victor Cousin

data.quote: Art  as far as it is able  follows nature  as a pupil imitates his master  thus your art must be  as it were  God's grandchild.
data.author: Dante Alighieri

data.quote: Great art is as irrational as great music. It is mad with its own loveliness.
data.author: George Jean Nathan

data.quote: A picture is a poem without words.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Art hath an enemy called ignorance.
data.author: Ben Jonson

data.quote: It's clever  but is it art?
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: Art is not an end in itself  but a means of addressing humanity.
data.author: M. P. Moussorgsky

data.quote: Art is a kind of illness.
data.author: Giacomo Puccini

data.quote: Art is indeed not the bread but the wine of life.
data.author: Jean Paul Richter

data.quote: Art is difficult  transient is her reward.
data.author: Friedrich von Schiller

data.quote: The artist does not see things as they are  but as he is.
data.author: Alfred Tonnelle

data.quote: When a dove begins to associate with crows its feathers remain white but its heart grows black.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: If you always live with those who are lame  you will yourself learn to limp.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I am an atheist  thank God!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I don't believe in God because I don't believe in Mother Goose.
data.author: Clarence Darrow

data.quote: The fool hath said in his heart  There is no God.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: That the universe was formed by a fortuitous concourse of atoms  I will no more believe than that the accidental jumbling of the alphabet would fall into a most ingenious treatise of philosophy.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: By night an atheist half believes in God.
data.author: Edward Young

data.quote: Audacity  more audacity  always audacity.
data.author: Georges Jacques Danton

data.quote: Fortune favors the audacious.
data.author: Erasmus

data.quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved die absolute rejection of authority.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: All authority belongs to the people.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: The highest duty is to respect authority.
data.author: Pope Leo

data.quote: He who writes prose builds his temple to Fame in rubble  he who writes verses builds it in granite.
data.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: The pen is the tongue of the mind.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: The author who speaks about his own books is almost as bad as a mother who talks about her own children.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: An incurable itch for scribbling takes possession of many  and grows inveterate in their insane breasts.
data.author: Juvenal

data.quote: You do not publish your own verses  Laelius  you criticise mine. Pray cease to criticise mine  or else publish your own.
data.author: Martial

data.quote: The ink of the scholar is more sacred than the blood of the martyr.
data.author: Mohammed

data.quote: The melancholy days have come  the saddest of the year  Of wailing winds  and naked woods  and meadows brown and sear.
data.author: William Cullen Bryant

data.quote: The year's in the wane  There is nothing adoring  The night has no eve  And the day has no morning  Cold winter gives warning!
data.author: Thomas Hood

data.quote: O  it sets my heart a clickin' like the tickin' of a clock  When the frost is on the punkin and the fodder's in the shock.
data.author: James Whitcomb Riley

data.quote: What can you conceive more silly and extravagant than to suppose a man racking his brains  and studying night and day how to fly?
data.author: William Law

data.quote: The birds can fly  An' why can't I?
data.author: John Trowbridge

data.quote: He rode upon a cherub  and did fly: yea  he did fly upon the wings of the wind.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Here we have baby. It is composed of a bald head and a pair of lungs.
data.author: Eugene Field

data.quote: Where did you come from  baby dear? Out of the Everywhere into here.
data.author: George Macdonald

data.quote: Rock-a-bye baby on the tree top  When the wind blows the cradle will rock  When the bough bends the cradle will fall  Down comes the baby  cradle and all.
data.author: Old Nursery Rhyme

data.quote: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Hush  my dear  lie still and slumber  Holy angels guard thy bed! Heavenly blessings without number Gently falling on thy head.
data.author: Isaac Watts

data.quote: Sweetest li'l feller  everybody knows  Dunno what to call him  but he's mighty lak' a rose  Lookin' at his mammy wid eyes so shiny blue Mek' you think that Heav'n is comin' clost ter you.
data.author: Frank L. Stanton

data.quote: A bachelor is one who enjoys the chase but does not eat the game.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A bachelor is a souvenir of some woman who found a better one at the last minute.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The best work  and of greatest merit for the public  has proceeded from the unmarried or childless men.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: A single man has not nearly the value he would have in a state of union. He is an incomplete animal. He resembles the odd half of a pair of scissors.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: By persistently remaining single a man converts himself into a permanent public temptation.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A banker is a man who lends you an umbrella when the weather is fair  and takes it away from you when it rains.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: It takes two to make a bargain.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: It's a bad bargain where nobody gains.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: The best of a bad bargain.
data.author: Samuel Pepys

data.quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.

data.quote: And all the loveliest things there be Come simply  so it seems to me.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: Beauty without expression tires.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Mathematics possesses not only truth  but supreme beauty - a beauty cold and austere  like that of a sculpture.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Remember that the most beautiful things in the world are the most useless  peacocks and lilies for instance.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Beauty is unbearable  drives us to despair  offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Beauty is potent but money is omnipotent.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: Beauty is truth - truth  beauty - that is all Ye know on earth  and all ye need to know.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: Ask a toad what is beauty? ... a female with two great round eyes coming out of her little head  a large flat mouth  a yellow belly and a brown back.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Grace is the absence of everything that indicates pain or difficulty  hesitation or incongruity.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful  we must carry it with us or we find it not.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Beauty is an ecstacy  it is as simple as hunger. There is really nothing to be said about it.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: As a beauty I am not a star  There are others more handsome by far  But my face - I don't mind it For I am behind it. It's the people in front get the jar.
data.author: Anthony Euwer

data.quote: Until I saw Chardin's painting  I never realized how much beauty lay around me in my parents' house  in the half-cleared table  in the corner of a tablecloth left awry  in the knife beside the empty oyster shell.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: The beauty of the animal form is in exact proportion to the amount of moral and intellectual virtue expressed by it.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Do you love me because I'm beautiful  or am I beautiful because you love me?
data.author: Oscar Hammerstein

data.quote: Beauty is everlasting And dust is for a time.
data.author: Marianne Moore

data.quote: Beauty  more than bitterness Makes the heart break.
data.author: Sara Teasdale

data.quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: We ascribe beauty to that which is simple  which has no superfluous parts  which exactly answers its ends.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Something wonderful and strange that the artist fashions out of the chaos of the world in the torment of his soul.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: Beauty is the purgation of superfluities.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: Beauty - the adjustment of all parts proportionately so that one cannot add or subtract or change without impairing the harmony of the whole.
data.author: Leon Battista Alberti

data.quote: Underneath this stone doth lie As much beauty as could die.
data.author: Ben Jonson

data.quote: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: A very beautiful woman hardly ever leaves a clear-cut impression of features and shape in the memory: usually there remains only an aura of living colour.
data.author: William Bolitho

data.quote: The excellence of every art is its intensity  capable of making all disagreeables evaporate  from their being in close relationship with beauty and truth.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: Exuberance is beauty.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: The Nature of This Flower is to bloom.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
data.author: Margaret Hungerford

data.quote: Some thoughts always find us young  and keep us so. Such a thought is the love of the universal and eternal beauty.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
data.author: Franz Kafka

data.quote: Let the beauty you love be what you do. There are a thousand ways to kneel and kiss the earth.
data.author: Rumi

data.quote: Beautiful is greater than Good  for it includes the Good.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: The most natural beauty in the world is honesty and moral truth. For all beauty is truth.
data.author: Lord Shaftesbury

data.quote: To do the useful thing  to say the courageous thing  to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: I'm tired of all the nonsense about beauty being only skin-deep. That's deep enough. What do you want - an adorable pancreas?
data.author: Jean Kerr

data.quote: The fountain of beauty is the heart  and every generous thought illustrates the walls of your chamber.
data.author: Francis Quarles

data.quote: Beauty as we feel it is something indescribable  what it is or what it means can never be said.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: There is certainly no absolute standard of beauty. That precisely is what makes its pursuit so interesting.
data.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

data.quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: When your inner eyes open  you can find immense beauty hidden within the inconsequential details of daily life. When your inner ears open  you can hear the subtle  lovely music of the universe everywhere you go.
data.author: Timothy Ray Miller

data.quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful  we must carry it with us or we will not find it.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
data.author: Lady Blessington

data.quote: That which is striking and beautiful is not always good  but that which is good is always beautiful.
data.author: Ninon de L'Enclos

data.quote: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever.
data.author: Keats Endymion

data.quote: Beauty is truth  truth beauty.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: She walks in beauty like the night Of cloudless climes and starry skies  And all that's best of dark and bright Meet in her aspect and her eyes: Thus mellowed to that tender light Which heaven to gaudy day denies.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Beauty is power  a smile is its sword.
data.author: Charles Reade

data.quote: Remember that the most beautiful things in the world are the most useless  peacocks and lilies  for instance.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: In bed we laugh  in bed we cry  And born in bed  in bed we die  The near approach a bed may show Of human bliss to human woe.
data.author: Isaac De Benserade

data.quote: As you make your bed you must lie in it.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: The bed has become a place of luxury to me! I would not exchange it for all the thrones in the world.
data.author: Napoleon

data.quote: The bee is more honored than other animals  not because she labors  but because she labors for others.
data.author: St. Chrysostom

data.quote: The bee that hath honey in her mouth hath a sting in her tail.
data.author: John Lyly

data.quote: How doth the little busy bee Improve each shining hour  And gather honey all the day From every opening flower.
data.author: Isaac Watts

data.quote: Set a beggar on horseback  and he will ride a gallop.
data.author: Henry Burton

data.quote: Better a living beggar than a buried emperor.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: Borrowing is not much better than begging.
data.author: Gotthold E. Lessing

data.quote: Well begun is half done.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: He that climbs a ladder must begin at the first round.
data.author: Walter Scott

data.quote: It is the beginning of the end.
data.author: Talleyrand

data.quote: The first step  my son  which one makes in the world  is the one on which depends the rest of our days.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: A youth with his first cigar makes himself sick  a youth with his first girl makes everybody sick.
data.author: Mary Wilson Little

data.quote: Love at first sight is easy to understand  it's when two people have been looking at each other for a lifetime that it becomes a miracle.
data.author: Sam Levenson

data.quote: Love is what happens to men and women who don't know each other.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: To love deeply in one direction makes us more loving in all others.
data.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

data.quote: No  this trick won't work. . . . How on earth are you ever going to explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love?
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Love is. the flower of life  and blossoms unexpectedly and without law  and must be plucked where it is found  and enjoyed for the brief hour of its duration.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: First love is a kind of vaccination which saves a man from catching the complaint the second time.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: At the touch of love  everyone becomes a poet.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Love is like quicksilver in the hand. Leave the fingers open and it stays. Clutch it  and it darts away.
data.author: Dorothy Parker

data.quote: Love is a madness  if thwarted it develops fast.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Love is like war  easy to begin but hard to end.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common-sense.
data.author: Helen Rowland

data.quote: I have learned not to worry about love  but to honor its coming with all my heart.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: I believe in love  but I don't sit around waiting for it.
data.author: Renee Zellweger

data.quote: What is irritating about love is that it is a crime that requires an accomplice.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: I cannot fix on the hour  or the spot  or the look  or the words  which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun.
data.author: Fitzwilliam Darcy

data.quote: Many people when they fall in love look for a little haven of refuge from the world  where they can be sure of being admired when they are not admirable  and praised when they are not praiseworthy.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: The art of love ... is largely the art of persistence.
data.author: Albert Ellis

data.quote: It is an extra dividend when you like the girl you've fallen in love with.
data.author: Clark Gable

data.quote: You can't buy love  but you can pay heavily for it.
data.author: Henny Youngman

data.quote: How delicious is the winning of a kiss at love's beginning.
data.author: Thomas Campbell

data.quote: Love is a deep well from which you may drink often  but into which you may fall but once.
data.author: Ellye Howell Glover

data.quote: We don't believe in rheumatism and true love until after the first attack.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: Love is like an hourglass  with the heart filling up as the brain empties.
data.author: Jule Renard

data.quote: Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: I was nauseous and tingly all over. I was either in love or I had smallpox.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: Love doesn't just sit there  like a stone  it has to be made  like bread  remade all the time  made new.
data.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

data.quote: Man reaches the highest point of lovableness at 12 to 17 - to get it back  in a second flowering  at the age of 70 to 90.
data.author: Isak Dinesen

data.quote: Love is a smoke raised with the fume of sighs  Being purged  a fire sparkling in lovers' eyes  Being vex'd a sea nourish'd with lovers' tears: What is it else? a madness most discreet  A choking gall and a preserving sweet.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Men willingly believe what they wish.
data.author: Julius Caesar

data.quote: Believe only half of what you see and nothing that you hear.
data.author: Dinah Mulock Craik

data.quote: A man must not swallow more beliefs than he can digest.
data.author: Havelock Ellis

data.quote: He that believeth not shall be damned.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Nothing is so firmly believed as what we least know.
data.author: Michel Montaigne

data.quote: She deceiving  I believing  What need lovers wish for more?
data.author: Sir Charles Sedley

data.quote: Curfew must not ring tonight.
data.author: Rosa H. Thorpe

data.quote: Those evening bells! those evening bells! How many a tale their music tells!
data.author: George Moore

data.quote: Ring out the old  ring in the new  Ring  happy bells  across the snow.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: Biography is the only true history.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: One anecdote of a man is worth a volume of biography.
data.author: William Ellery Channing

data.quote: Lives of great men all remind us We can make our lives sublime  And  departing  leave behind us Footprints on the sands of time.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: To be ignorant of the lives of the most celebrated men of antiquity is to continue in a state of childhood all our days.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: Every great man nowadays has his disciples  and it is always Judas who writes the biography.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: O thrush  your song is passing sweet  But never a song that you have sung Is half so sweet as thrushes sang When my dear love and I were young.
data.author: William Morris

data.quote: Birds of a feather will flock together.
data.author: Minsheu

data.quote: And the Raven  never flitting  Still is sitting  still is sitting On the pallid bust of Pallas Just above my chamber door  And his eyes have all the seeming Of a demon's that is dreaming  And the lamplight o'er him streaming Throws his shadow on the floor  And my soul from out that shadow  That lies floating on the floor  Shall be lifted - nevermore.
data.author: Edgar Allan Poe

data.quote: Acorns are planted silently by some unnoticed breeze.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: The egg it is the source of all To everyone's ancestral hall.
data.author: Clarence Day

data.quote: Being pregnant is a very boring six months. I am not particularly maternal. It's an occupational hazard of being a wife.
data.author: Princess Anne

data.quote: The government is concerned about the population explosion  and the population is concerned about the government explosion.
data.author: Ruth Rankin

data.quote: We have been God-like in our planned breeding of our domestic plants and animals  but rabbit-like in our unplanned breeding of ourselves.
data.author: Arnold Toynbee

data.quote: Some are born to sweet delight  Some are born to endless night.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: In my beginning is my end.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: When I was born I did lament and cry And now each day doth shew the reason why.
data.author: Richard Watkyns

data.quote: Where  unwilling  dies the rose  Buds the new  another year.
data.author: Dorothy Parker

data.quote: Husbands don't really count ... in the miracle of birth.
data.author: Doug Spettigue

data.quote: And when I was born  I drew in the common air  and fell upon the earth  which is of like nature  and the first voice which I uttered was crying  as all others do . . . For all men have one entrance into life. The Apocrypha Monday's child is fair of face  Tuesday's child is full of grace  Wednesday's child is full of woe Thursday's child has far to go Friday's child is loving and giving  Saturday's child works hard for a living  But the child born on the Sabbath day Is happy and wise and good and gay.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: As the births of living creatures at first are ill-shapen  so are all innovations  which are the births of time.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: Born on Monday  fair in the face  Born on Tuesday  full of God's grace  Born on Wednesday  sour and sad  Born on Thursday  merry and glad  Born on Friday  worthily given
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I can't tell you his age  but when he was born the wonder drug was Mercurochrome.
data.author: Milton Berle

data.quote: You know you're getting older when you don't care where your wife goes  just so you don't have to go along.
data.author: Jacob Braude

data.quote: Enjoy how sweet  how thoughtful  how kind I'm being on your birthday. Because tomorrow it's back to the same old crap.
data.author: Melvin Helitzer

data.quote: As one cat said to another: Birthdays are like fur balls - the more you have  the more you gag.

data.quote: You can live to be a hundred  if you give up all the things that make you want to live to a hundred.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: She claims she just turned thirty  but it must have been a U-turn!
data.author: Elmer Pasta

data.quote: She's not pushing forty  she's dragging it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: My wife never lies about her age. She just tells everyone she's as old as I am. Then she lies about my age.
data.author: Robert Orben

data.quote: Looking fifty is great - if you're sixty.

data.quote: Middle age is having a choice between two temptations and choosing the one that'll get you home earlier.
data.author: Dan Bennett

data.quote: For weeks I've been telling him not to buy anything for my birthday  and he still forgot to bring me something.

data.quote: The age of some women is like the speedometer on a used car - you know it's set back  but you don't know how far.

data.quote: What can you say when your husband says: 'You can't expect me to remember your birthday when you never look any older."

data.quote: The best contraceptive for old people is nudity.

data.quote: Pushing fifty is exercise enough.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: After thirty  a body has a mind of its own.

data.quote: Of all the things I miss  the thing I miss the most is my mind.

data.quote: My health is good  it's my age that's bad.
data.author: Roy Acuff

data.quote: I stay away from natural foods. At my age I need all the preservatives I can get.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: At eighty-eight how do you feel when getting up in the morning? . . . Amazed!

data.quote: Wisdom doesn't automatically come with old age. Nothing does - except wrinkles. It's true  some wines improve with age. But only if the grapes were good in the first place.

data.quote: He's so old his social security number is two digits.
data.author: Brian Morgan

data.quote: Sometimes I feel that I'm not just aging . . . I'm decomposing.

data.quote: My notion of a wife at forty is that a man should be able to change her  like a banknote  for two twenties.

data.quote: Middle age is when your old classmates are so gray and wrinkled and bald they don't recognize you.
data.author: Bennett Cerf

data.quote: It's a sobering thought: When Mozart was my age  he had been dead for two years.

data.quote: You know you're getting old when you stoop to tie your shoes and wonder what else you can do while you're down there.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: When I think of my dad as a little boy  I tend to think of him in black and white.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The really frightening thing about middle age is the knowledge that you'll grow out of it.
data.author: Doris Day

data.quote: I don't generally feel anything until noon  then it's time for my nap.
data.author: Bob Hope

data.quote: The years between fifty and seventy are the hardest. You are always asked to do things  and you are not yet decrepit enough to turn them down.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: It's an awful thing to grow old by yourself. My wife hasn't had a birthday in seven years.
data.author: Robert Orben

data.quote: I'm sixty-five  but if there were fifteen months in every year  I'd only be forty-eight.
data.author: James Thurber

data.quote: Try to accept each other for what you are  and don't point out the fact that the hair he's losing on his head is now growing out of his nose - and his ears.
data.author: Peg Bundy

data.quote: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Middle age is when anything new in the way you feel is most likely a symptom.
data.author: Laurence J. Peter

data.quote: There's one advantage to being 102. There's no peer pressure.

data.quote: Middle age is when you have met so many people that every new person you meet reminds you of someone else and usually is.

data.quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.

data.quote: Actually  being sixty-five isn't so bad. As a matter of fact I rather like being called a sexagenarian. At this time of life it sounds like flattery.

data.quote: Middle age is when your narrow waist and broad mind begin to change places.

data.quote: The secret to longevity is to keep breathing.

data.quote: I'm at the stage of life when if a girl says no to me I'm profoundly grateful to her.

data.quote: People who have the most birthdays live the longest.

data.quote: Middle age occurs when you are too young to take up golf and too old to rush up to the net.

data.quote: I have everything I had twenty years ago  only it's all a little bit lower.

data.quote: I may be forty  but every morning when I get up  I feel like a twenty-year-old. Unfortunately  there's never one around.

data.quote: To what do you attribute your advanced age? Well  I suppose I must attribute it to the fact that I have not died.

data.quote: Age is mind over matter. If you don't mind  it doesn't matter.
data.author: Satchel Paige

data.quote: She's too young for Medicare and too old for me to care.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: When she told me her age I believed her - why not? she hasn't changed her story for five years.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: There are three signs of old age: loss of memory ... I forget the other two.

data.quote: She was born in the year of our Lord only knows. The years that a woman subtracts from her age are not lost. They are added to other women's.

data.quote: Old age is like everything else  to make a success of it you got to start young.

data.quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: The cost of living is going up and the chance of living is going down.

data.quote: I was just thinking  when I was a young girl  I never knew what every young girl was supposed to know. And now I am going to be an old lady  I don't know what every old lady is supposed to know.

data.quote: He is at an age that whenever a pretty girl smiles at him he immediately looks down to see what is unzipped.

data.quote: Life begins at fifty  but so does bad eyesight  arthritis  and the habit of telling the same story three times to the same listeners.

data.quote: Women  don't get a tattoo. That butterfly looks great on your breast when you're twenty or thirty  but when you get to be seventy  it stretches into a condor.

data.quote: When Julia Child was asked to what she credited her longevity  she replied  "Red meat and gin."

data.quote: Once my wife gave me a wonderful birthday present. She let me win an argument.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: When we're young we want to change the world. When we're old we want to change the young.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly  eat slowly  and lie about your age.

data.quote: I refuse to admit I'm more than fifty-two  even if that does make my sons illegitimate.

data.quote: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you are aboard there is nothing you can do.

data.quote: The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.

data.quote: I'm at an age where my back goes out more than I do.
data.author: Phyllis Diller

data.quote: Remember when we used to laugh at old people when we were young? Do you recall what was so funny?

data.quote: If you want to know how old a woman is . . . ask her sister-in-law.

data.quote: You know you are getting older when "happy hour" is a nap.

data.quote: I wouldn't say someone is old just because his social security is in Roman numerals or because Mozart played at his senior prom.

data.quote: Gray hair is God's graffiti.

data.quote: If you think a lot of the comments made tonight are not funny  but are immature and tasteless  that's only because the sense of humor is the first thing to go.

data.quote: I was going to take you out to lunch for your birthday . . . but you already are.

data.quote: You're only young once  but you can always be immature.

data.quote: Diaper backward spells repaid. Think about it.

data.quote: I think of birth as the search for a larger apartment.

data.quote: Always a godfather - never a god!

data.quote: My husband and I are either going to buy a dog or have a child. We can't decide whether to ruin our carpet or ruin our lives.

data.quote: Blessings never come in pairs  misfortunes never come alone.

data.quote: God bless us every one.

data.quote: The old blood is bold blood  the wide world round.

data.quote: We are bound to our bodies like an oyster to its shell.

data.quote: If any thing is sacred  the human body is sacred.

data.quote: Fortune favours the bold.

data.quote: Chance does nothing that has not been prepared beforehand.

data.quote: Chance usually favors the prudent man.

data.quote: Combine common sense and the Golden Rule  and you will have very little bad luck.

data.quote: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.

data.quote: A lexicographer  a writer of dictionaries  a harmless drudge.

data.quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they really happened and after you are finished reading one you feel that it all happened to you and after which it all belongs to you.

data.quote: If a book is worth reading at all  it is worth reading more than once. Suspense is the lowest of excitants  designed to take your breath away when the brain and heart crave to linger in nobler enjoyment. Suspense drags you on  appreciation causes you to linger.

data.quote: If you would not be forgotten as soon as you are dead  either write things worth reading or do things worth writing.

data.quote: Neither is a dictionary a bad book to read. There is no cant in it  no excess of explanation  and it is full of suggestions  the raw material of possible poems and histories.

data.quote: Nothing links man to man like the frequent passage from hand to hand of a good book.
data.author: Walter Sickert

data.quote: Some books are undeservedly forgotten  none are undeservedly remembered.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: The delight of opening a new pursuit  or a new course of reading  imparts the vivacity and novelty of youth even to old age.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: The dust and silence of the upper shelf.
data.author: Bob Macaulay

data.quote: The fact of knowing how to read is nothing  the whole point is knowing what to read.
data.author: Jacques Ellul

data.quote: The habit of reading is the only enjoyment in which there is no alloy  it lasts when all other pleasures fade.
data.author: Anthony Trollope

data.quote: The possession of a book becomes a substitute for reading it.
data.author: Anthony Burgess

data.quote: The responsibility of a dictionary is to record a language  not set its style.
data.author: Phillip Babcock Gove

data.quote: To finish is both a relief and a release from an extraordinarily pleasant prison.
data.author: Robert Burchfield

data.quote: What is reading but silent conversation?
data.author: Walter Savage Landor

data.quote: 'Sartor Resartus' is simply unreadable  and for me that always sort of spoils a book.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: You should read it  though there is much that is skip-worthy.
data.author: Herbert Asquith

data.quote: The greatest masterpiece in literature is only a dictionary out of order.
data.author: Jean Cocteau

data.quote: When you read a classic you do not see in the book more than you did before. You see more in you than there was before.
data.author: Clifton Fadiman

data.quote: Properly we should read for power. Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: Best-sellerism is the star system of the book world. A (best-seller) is a celebrity among books. It is a book known primarily (sometimes exclusively) for its well-knownness.
data.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

data.quote: The central theme of the novel is that they were glad to see each other.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: Reading after a certain (time) diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: The most technologically efficient machine that man has ever invented is the book.
data.author: Northrop Frye

data.quote: Literature is news that stays news.
data.author: Ezra Pound

data.quote: Just the knowledge that a good book is awaiting one at the end of a long day makes that day happier.
data.author: Kathleen Norris

data.quote: Laws die  books never.

data.quote: Master books  but do not let them master you. Read to live  not live to read.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: A good book is the precious life-blood of a master spirit  embalmed and treasured up on purpose to a life beyond life.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: Any book which is at all important should be re-read immediately.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. They're never fattening  seldom sinful  and permanently personal.
data.author: Lenore Hershey

data.quote: Never lend books - nobody ever returns them  the only books I have in my library are those which people have lent me.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: Discretion is not the better part of biography.
data.author: Lytton Strachey

data.quote: A dictionary should be descriptive  not prescriptive.
data.author: Phillip Babcock Gove

data.quote: Book lovers never go to bed alone.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: It circulated for five years  through the halls of fifteen publishers  and finally ended up with Vanguard Press  which as you can see is rather deep into the alphabet.
data.author: Patrick Dennis

data.quote: The first book of the nation is the dictionary of its language.
data.author: Contanitin, Comte de Volney

data.quote: A novel is a mirror carried along a main road.
data.author: Stendhal

data.quote: I read part of it all the way through.
data.author: Sam Goldwyn

data.quote: A successful book cannot afford to be more than ten percent new.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: First publication is a pure  carnal leap into that dark which one dreams is life.
data.author: Hortense Calisher

data.quote: Books give not wisdom where none was before. But where some is  there reading makes it more.
data.author: John Harington

data.quote: A good book has no ending.
data.author: R. D. Dimming

data.quote: Oh that my words were now written! Oh that they were printed in a book!
data.author: Bible

data.quote: What a sense of security in an old book which time has criticized for us!
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: I hate books  they teach us only to talk about what we do not know.
data.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

data.quote: Tis the good reader that makes the good book.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The telephone book is full of facts but it doesn't contain a single idea.
data.author: Mortimer J. Adler

data.quote: In the case of good books  the point is not to see how many of them you can get through  but rather how many can get through to you.
data.author: Mortimer J. Adler

data.quote: Books think for me.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: Dictionaries are like watches. The worst is better than none at all and even the best cannot be expected to run quite true.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Does it afflict you to find your books wearing out? I mean literally .. . the mortality of all inanimate things is terrible to me  but that of books most of all.
data.author: William Dean Howells

data.quote: The true university of these days is a collection of books.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: I keep my books at the British Museum and at Mudies.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: One man is as good as another until he has written a book.
data.author: Benjamin Jowett

data.quote: If a book is worth reading  it is worth buying.

data.quote: Business is really more agreeable than pleasure  it interests the whole mind . . . more deeply. But it does not look as if it did.
data.author: Walter Bagehot

data.quote: The ability to deal with people is as purchasable a commodity as sugar or coffee. And I pay more for that ability than for any other under the sun.
data.author: John D. Rockefeller

data.quote: In all modern depressions  recessions  or growth-correction  as variously they are called  we never miss the goods that are not produced. We miss only the opportunities for the labour - for the jobs - that are not provided.
data.author: J. K. Galbraith

data.quote: The solid wealth of insurance companies and the success of those who organize gambling are some indication of the profits to be derived from the efficient use of chance.
data.author: Edward de Bono

data.quote: To convert an hourly wage to an approximate yearly salary  double the wage and change the decimal to a comma.
data.author: Don Tichnor

data.quote: After an eight-hour day  workers require three overtime hours to produce two regular hours of results.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Gross National Product is our Holy Grail.
data.author: Stuart Udall

data.quote: When two men in business always agree  one of them is unnecessary.
data.author: William Wrigley

data.quote: Few great men could pass Personnel.
data.author: Paul Goodman

data.quote: You build on cost and you borrow on value.
data.author: Paul Reichmann

data.quote: By pursuing his own interest (the individual) frequently promotes that of the society more effectually than when he really intends to promote it. I have never known much good done by those who affected to trade for the public good.
data.author: Adam Smith

data.quote: Management is now where the medical profession was when it decided that working in a drug store was not sufficient training to become a doctor.
data.author: Lawrence Appley

data.quote: The Bell System is like a damn big dragon. You kick it in the tail  and two years later  it feels it in its head.
data.author: Frederick Kappel

data.quote: Benefits should be granted little by little  so that they may be better enjoyed.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: The price spoils the pleasure.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: Whose bread I eat  his song I sing.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: To carry care to bed is to sleep with a pack on your back.
data.author: Thomas Haliburton

data.quote: The night shall be filled with music And the cares that infest the day Shall fold their tents like the Arabs  And as silently steal away.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Old Care has a mortgage on every estate  And that's what you pay for the wealth that you get.
data.author: J. G. Saxe

data.quote: Providence has given us hope and sleep as a compensation for the many cares of life.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: For want of a nail the shoe was lost  for want of a shoe the horse was lost  and for want of a horse the rider was lost  being overtaken and slain by the enemy  all for want of care about a horseshoe nail.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Carelessness does more harm than a want of knowledge.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: The wife of a careless man is almost a widow.
data.author: Hungarian proverb

data.quote: Ding  dong  bell  Pussy's in the well  Who put her in? Little Tommy Green. Who pulled her out? Little Johnny Stout.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: When the cat's away the mice will play.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: It has been die providence of nature to give this creature nine lives instead of one.
data.author: Pilpay

data.quote: There is not room to swing a cat.
data.author: George Smollett

data.quote: A cat may look at a king.
data.author: John Heywood

data.quote: There is one basic cause of all effects.
data.author: Giordano Bruno

data.quote: In war events of importance are the result of trivial causes.
data.author: Julius Caesar

data.quote: Christian Science explains all cause and effect as mental  not physical.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: God befriend us  as our cause is just!
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Everything in nature is a cause from which there flows some effect.
data.author: Spinoza

data.quote: The first springs of great events  like those of great rivers  are often mean and little.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: If your lips would keep from slips five things observe with care: To whom you speak  of whom you speak  And how  and when  and where.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Hasten slowly.
data.author: Augustus Caesar

data.quote: A wise man does not trust all his eggs to one basket.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: When you go to buy use your eyes  not your ears.
data.author: Czech proverb

data.quote: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: The cautious seldom err.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: Among mortals second thoughts are wisest.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Little boats should keep near shore.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Caution is the eldest child of wisdom.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Drink nothing without seeing it  sign nothing without reading it.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: It is a good thing to learn caution by the misfortunes of others.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: To limit the press is to insult a nation  to prohibit reading of certain books is to declare the inhabitants to be either fools or slaves.
data.author: Claude Adrien Helvetius

data.quote: The dirtiest book of all is the expurgated book.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: No member of a society has a right to teach any doctrine contrary to what society holds to be true.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written or badly written.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Knowledge cannot defile  nor consequently the books  if the will and conscience be not defiled.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: We can never be sure that the opinion we are endeavouring to stifle is a false opinion  and if we were sure  stifling it would be an evil still.
data.author: John Stuart Mill

data.quote: No government ought to be without censors  and where the press is free  no one ever will.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Censorship  like charity  should begin at home  but unlike charity  it should end there.
data.author: Clare Boothe Luce

data.quote: Obscenity is whatever gives a judge an erection.
data.author: Anonymous American Lawyer

data.quote: You censure this with difficulty because you have allowed it to become customary.
data.author: St. Jerome

data.quote: I am mortified to be told that  in the United States of America  the sale of a book can become a subject of inquiry  and of criminal inquiry too.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: If there had been a censorship of the press in Rome we should have had today neither Horace nor Juvenal  nor the philosophical writings of Cicero.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Every burned book enlightens the world.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I make the most of all that comes  And the least of all that goes.
data.author: Sara Teasdale

data.quote: If you do not expect it  you will not find the unexpected  for it is hard to find and difficult.
data.author: Heraclitus

data.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less travelled by  And that has made all the difference.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Unless a man has trained himself for his chance  the chance will only make him ridiculous.
data.author: W. Matthews

data.quote: Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast. In the pool where you least expect it  will be a fish.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Chance is the pseudonym of God when he did not want to sign.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: The harder you work  the luckier you get.
data.author: Gary Player

data.quote: I think we consider too much the good luck of the early bird and not enough the bad luck of the early worm.
data.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

data.quote: Fortune favours the bold.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: The luck of having talent is not enough  one must also have a talent for luck.
data.author: Hector Berlioz

data.quote: In the field of observation  chance favours the prepared mind.
data.author: Louis Pasteur

data.quote: If you were born lucky  even your rooster will lay eggs.
data.author: Russian proverb

data.quote: Depend on the rabbit's foot if you will  but remember it didn't work for the rabbit!
data.author: R. E. Shay

data.quote: Those who mistake their good luck for their merit are inevitably bound for disaster.
data.author: J. Christopher Herold

data.quote: Luck is being ready for the chance.
data.author: J. Frank Dobie

data.quote: Every man  even the most blessed  needs a little more than average luck to survive this world.
data.author: Vance Bourjaily

data.quote: With luck on your side you can do without brains.
data.author: Giordano Bruno

data.quote: If fortune turns against you  even jelly breaks your tooth.
data.author: Persian proverb

data.quote: Fortune brings in some boats that are not steered.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I'm a great believer in luck. I find the harder I work  the more I have of it.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: Vexed sailors curse the rain For which poor shepherds prayed in vain.
data.author: Edmund Waller

data.quote: A permanent state of transition is man's most noble condition.
data.author: Juan Ramon Jimenez

data.quote: Change is not made without inconvenience  even from worse to better.
data.author: Richard Hooker

data.quote: All things are subject to change  and we change with them. (Omnia mutantur  nos et mutamur in illis.)
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If you want things to stay as they are  things will have to change.
data.author: Giuseppe di Lampedusa

data.quote: The days come and go like muffled and veiled figures sent from a distant friendly party  but they say nothing  and if we do not use the gifts they bring  they carry them as silently away.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The more things change  the more they stay the same. (Plus ca change  plus c'est la meme chose.)
data.author: Alphonse Karr

data.quote: There are three things which the public will always clamor for  sooner or later: namely  novelty  novelty  novelty.
data.author: Thomas Hood

data.quote: There is nothing permanent except change.
data.author: Heraclitus

data.quote: You can't step into the same river twice.
data.author: Heraclitus

data.quote: What is actual is actual only for one time. And only for one place.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: As one gets older  one discovers everything is going to be exactly the same with different hats on.
data.author: Noel Coward

data.quote: All changes  even the most longed for  have their melancholy  for what we leave behind us is apart of ourselves  we must die to one life before we can enter into another.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: When you get there  there isn't any there there.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: Change must be measured from a known base line.
data.author: Evan Shute

data.quote: I can generally bear the separation  but I don't like the leave-taking.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: All things must change to something new  to something strange.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: I see gr-reat changes takin' place ivry day  but no change at all ivry fifty years.
data.author: Finley Peter Dunne

data.quote: 'Change' is scientific  'progress' is ethical  change is indubitable  whereas progress is a matter of controversy.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Turbulence is life force. It is opportunity. Let's love turbulence and use it for change.
data.author: Ramsay Clark

data.quote: Would that life were like the shadow cast by a wall or a tree  but it is like the shadow of a bird in flight.
data.author: The Talmud

data.quote: Everything passes  everything wears out  everything breaks.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: I've learned only that you never say never.
data.author: Marina von Neumann Whitman

data.quote: Always! That is the dreadful word ... it is a meaningless word  too.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: The most ominous of fallacies: the belief that things can be kept static by inaction.
data.author: Freya Stark

data.quote: What is actual is actual only for one time  and only for one place.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: Our days are a kaleidoscope. Every instant a change takes place. ... New harmonies  new contrasts  new combinations of every sort. ... The most familiar people stand each moment in some new relation to each other  to their work  to surrounding objects.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Just when I think I have learned the way to live  life changes.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: We change  whether we like it or not.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The one unchangeable certainty is that nothing is certain or unchangeable.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: All things must change to something new  to something strange.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Because things are the way they are  things will not stay the way they are.
data.author: Bertolt Brecht

data.quote: The moral world is as little exempt as the physical world from the law of ceaseless change  of perpetual flux.
data.author: Sir James Frazer

data.quote: Wherever we are  it is but a stage on the way to somewhere else  and whatever we do  however well we do it  it is only a preparation to do something else that shall be different.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: All is change  all yields its place and goes.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: O visionary world  condition strange  Where naught abiding is but only change.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Things alter for the worse spontaneously  if they be not altered for the better designedly.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: For good and evil  man is a free creative spirit. This produces the very queer world we live in  a world in continuous creation and therefore continuous change and insecurity.
data.author: Joyce Cary

data.quote: All things change  nothing is extinguished.
data.author: Ovid
